tool.name: htseq-clip
tool.description: - A toolset for the analysis of eCLIP/iCLIP datasets
tool.command: #if $action_type.action_type_selector == 'create_sliding_windows': python '$__tool_directory__/htsc_create_sliding_windows.py' --gff '$action_type.gff_file' --out ./ $action_type.gff_unsorted --hcw-w $action_type.hcw_options.hcw_w --hcw-s $action_type.hcw_options.hcw_s --no-zipper #elif $action_type.action_type_selector == 'create_count_table': python '$__tool_directory__/htsc_create_count_table.py' --win-bed '$action_type.win_bed_file' --exp-bams #for $i in $action_type.exp_bams: $i.exp_bam #end for --ctr-bams #for $i in $action_type.ctr_bams: $i.ctr_bam #end for --data-id '$action_type.data_id' --out ./ --hce-e $action_type.hce_options.hce_e --hce-s '${action_type.hce_options.hce_s}' --hce-g $action_type.hce_options.hce_g --hce-q $action_type.hce_options.hce_q $action_type.hce_options.hce_primary --hce-c 1 --hce-m $action_type.hce_options.hce_m --hce-x $action_type.hce_options.hce_x --hce-l $action_type.hce_options.hce_l #if $action_type.hce_options.hce_f: --hce-f '$action_type.hce_options.hce_f' #end if #if $action_type.hce_options.filter_bed: --filter-bed '$action_type.hce_options.filter_bed' --filter-mode $action_type.hce_options.filter_mode #end if $action_type.hcc_options.hcc_unstranded --no-zipper #end if

param.name: gff_file
param.label: GFF annotation file
param.help: Provide a genomic annotation file in GFF3 format

param.name: gff_unsorted
param.label: Is the GFF file unsorted?
param.help: Check if GFF file is unsorted (default: GFF file is assumed to be sorted)

param.name: hcw_w
param.label: Sliding window size
param.help: Set the sliding window size in nucleotides. If unsure, try 75-100 (default: 50)

param.name: hcw_s
param.label: Sliding window step size
param.help: Set the sliding window step size (default: 20)

param.name: annot_bed_out
param.label: Output annotation BED file
param.help: Output annotation BED file used for creating sliding windows

param.name: exp_bam
param.label: BAM files belonging to the CLIP-seq experiment
param.help: Select BAM file belonging to the CLIP-seq experiment. NOTE that order determines replicate numbering in output tables

param.name: ctr_bam
param.label: BAM files belonging to the CLIP-seq control
param.help: Select BAM file belonging to the CLIP-seq control. NOTE that order determines replicate numbering in output tables

param.name: win_bed_file
param.label: Sliding windows BED file
param.help: Provide a genomic regions BED file for calculating crosslink site overlap counts. Typically this is the sliding windows BED file created with htseq-clip's 'Create sliding windows' procedure

param.name: data_id
param.label: Dataset ID
param.help: Provide a dataset ID (e.g., RNA-binding protein name) used in the generated data table (default: Rbp)

param.name: hce_e
param.label: Read mate to extract crosslink sites from
param.help: Select the read mate (1, 2) to extract crosslink sites from. For single-end CLIP-seq data, select 1 (default: 1)

param.name: hce_s
param.label: Specify crosslink site position on read
param.help: Specify crosslink site position in the read, i.e., the genomic position to be extrated (default: middle position)

param.name: hce_g
param.label: Crosslink site offset
param.help: Number of nucleotides to offset for crosslink sites. Can be positive (upstream direction) or negative (downstream direction) (default: 0)

param.name: hce_q
param.label: Minimum alignment quality
param.help: Minimum alignment quality for filtering input BAM files. BAM entries greater than set quality will be filtered out (default: 10)

param.name: hce_primary
param.label: Use only primary positions of multimapping reads?
param.help: Check if only primary positions of multimapping reads should be kept

param.name: hce_m
param.label: Minimum read length
param.help: Minimum read length for filtering input BAM files (default: 0)

param.name: hce_x
param.label: Maximum read length
param.help: Maximum read length for filtering input BAM files (default: 500)

param.name: hce_l
param.label: Maximum read interval length
param.help: Maximum read interval length for filtering input BAM files (default: 10000)

param.name: hce_f
param.label: Specify chromosomes to extract crosslink sites from
param.help: Extract crosslink sites only from chromosomes given in this file (format: one chromsome ID per file)

param.name: filter_bed
param.label: BED file for filtering out BAM entries
param.help: Provide BED file to filter BAM entries based on their overlap with genomic regions inside the provided BED file

param.name: filter_mode
param.label: Filtering mode for BED filtering
param.help: Specify mode of filtering out BAM entries, with respect to the genomic regions inside the provided BED file)
param.option: Keep BAM entries not overlapping with BED regions
Keep only BAM entries overlapping with BED regions

param.name: hcc_unstranded
param.label: Should crosslink site counting be non-strand-specific?
param.help: Check if crosslink site position should be counted for overlapping features on both strands

data.name: windows_txt_file
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Windows annotation table file (DEWSeq input)

data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: Sample information table file (DEWSeq input)

tool.help:
**Overview**
htseq-clip is a toolset for the analysis of eCLIP/iCLIP datasets. It can be used to generate files necessary for data analysis using the companion R/Bioconductor package DEWSeq_ (available on Galaxy as well).
The Galaxy wrapper of htseq-clip provides the following two functionalities:
1) Create sliding windows 2) Create count table
**Create sliding windows**
In this mode, htseq-clip takes a genomic annotation file (GFF3 format), flattens it (i.e., overlapping regions get merged), and based on the flattened annotation BED file creates a sliding windows BED file. The window size and step size can be specified. E.g., a window size of 50 and a step size of 20 means that a window of 50 nt is extracted at every 20 nt step along each of the regions in the annotation BED file. In the end, a table file is output, containing the windows and additional annotation information. This table file serves as one of the input files for DEWSeq. In addition, the windows BED file is output, which is needed as input for the "Create count table" mode.
**Create count table**
In this mode, htseq-clip takes the windows BED file created in "Create count table" mode, as well as the CLIP-seq BAM files (experiment BAMs and control BAMs). Various options are available for filtering the BAM files and modifying the counting procedure. htseq-clip then counts the number of overlapping BAM entries for each BAM file and each window in the input BED file. In the end, a count table file is output, as well as a sample information table file, which both serve as input files for DEWSeq.
**Documentation and Repository**
htseq-clip's online documentation can be found at:
https://htseq-clip.readthedocs.io
Its GitHub page is available at:
https://github.com/EMBL-Hentze-group/htseq-clip
.. _DEWSeq: https://bioconductor.org/packages/release/bioc/html/DEWSeq.html
